gene_expression_omnibus_data_processing: RNA-seq reads were aligned to reference sequence using Bowtie 1.2.1.1The sequence alignment/map (SAM) files were post-processed using SAMTools 0.1.19Differentially Expressed Genes (DEG) were analyzed by Cuffdiff to calculate fragments per kilobase of exon per million fragments (FPKM) and differential expression, respectively, with default options and library type of dUTP RNA-seqSupplementary_files_format_and_content: tab-delimited text files include FPKM values for each sample
gene_expression_omnibus_extraction_proto: Total RNA was stabilized with the bacterial reagent RNAprotect (Qiagen, Hilden, Germany) and then extracted using an RNeasy Mini Kit (Qiagen, Hilden, Germany) along with On-Column DNase Digestion using RNAse-Free DNase Set (Qiagen, Hilden, Germany) following the manufacturer’s protocols.Total RNA quality and quantity were measured using an RNA 6000 Nano kit with the Agilent Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies, CA, USA). Then rRNA was removed using Ribo-Zero rRNA removal kits (Gram-negative bacteria; Epicentre, Madison, WI, USA) and then RNA was used for sequencing library using TruSeq Stranded Total RNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina, USA) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Briefly, transcriptome sequencing was conducted using Illumina/Hiseq-2000 RNA sequencing (Macrogen, Korea).
gene_expression_omnibus_growth_protocol: M. alcaliphilum 20Z was grown in 50 mL NMS medium33 at 30 oC with 230 rpm agitation in a 500 mL baffled flask sealed with a screw cap, and ethane was supplied to a final concentration of 50% (v/v) by gas substitution using a gas-tight syringe. For mixed substrates, engineered M. alcaliphilum 20Z was cultured in the same medium with the addition of 10 g/L xylose as a co-substrate. The initial OD600 of each culture was 0.1 for growth rate experiments. For RNA-seq experiments, all cultures were grown in biological duplicates for subsequent RNA extraction and sequencing steps.
gene_expression_omnibus_treatment_protoc: Diffirent substrates (methane and methane plus xylose)

gene_expression_omnibus_data_processing: BasecallingTrimming reads by Trimmomatic trimmomatic SE -threads 4 -phred33 \  ${INPUT_DIR}/${line}.fastq \  ${OUTPUT_DIR}/${line}_trimmed.fastq \  ILLUMINACLIP:/home/n-z/pei3/rnaseq_analysis/se_adapter.fa:2:15:10 LEADING:28 TRAILING:28 MINLEN:30Aligning reads by BWA-MEM.  bwa mem -t=8 -v=1 \  bwamem/bwa_index/b_index \  results/trim/${line}_trimmed.fastq|samtools sort -@8 -o bwamem/${line}_sorted.bam -Genes were counted by FeatureCounts from package edgeR. (For source codes of following steps, please refer to github page https://github.com/raogroupuiuc)Raw count matrix were normalized based on library size and sequencing depth, and a pseudocount matrix was generated with prior count=1 (to avoid log zero) and statistal analysis was performed on pseudocount matrixGenome_build: Methylococcus capsulatus str Bath. NCBI entry: NC_002977.6Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw count matrix including all 15 samples and all genes in txt formatSupplementary_files_format_and_content: Pseudocount matrix in tab limited formatSupplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw count for each sample (listed individually)
gene_expression_omnibus_extraction_proto: When OD reaches ~0.8, RNA protect reagent was added into culture and RNAs were extracted by Rneasy mini kit immediately after collection.RNA libraries were prepared for sequencing using standard Illumina protocols
gene_expression_omnibus_growth_protocol: A fresh overnight culture was inoculated into AMS medium so that OD=0.03. Headspace is filled with 50% CH4 and 50% air with 2atm. Grown at 37C at 200rpm.
gene_expression_omnibus_treatment_protoc: Different amount of H2S is injected into headspace to reach 0.1%, 0.5% and 0.75%, and grown as the control. The H2S shock treatment is to inject H2S into a control culture's headspace at mid-log phase(OD~0.6) and incubate for 1hr before collection.

gene_expression_omnibus_data_processing: BasecallingTrimming reads by Trimmomatic trimmomatic SE -threads 4 -phred33 \  ${INPUT_DIR}/${line}.fastq \  ${OUTPUT_DIR}/${line}_trimmed.fastq \  ILLUMINACLIP:/home/n-z/pei3/rnaseq_analysis/se_adapter.fa:2:15:10 LEADING:28 TRAILING:28 MINLEN:30Aligning reads by BWA-MEM.  bwa mem -t=8 -v=1 \  bwamem/bwa_index/b_index \  results/trim/${line}_trimmed.fastq|samtools sort -@8 -o bwamem/${line}_sorted.bam -Genes were counted by FeatureCounts from package edgeR. (For source codes of following steps, please refer to github page https://github.com/raogroupuiuc)Raw count matrix were normalized based on library size and sequencing depth, and a pseudocount matrix was generated with prior count=1 (to avoid log zero) and statistal analysis was performed on pseudocount matrixGenome_build: Methylococcus capsulatus str Bath. NCBI entry: NC_002977.6Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw count matrix including all 15 samples and all genes in txt formatSupplementary_files_format_and_content: Pseudocount matrix in tab limited formatSupplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw count for each sample (listed individually)
gene_expression_omnibus_extraction_proto: When OD reaches ~0.8, RNA protect reagent was added into culture and RNAs were extracted by Rneasy mini kit immediately after collection.RNA libraries were prepared for sequencing using standard Illumina protocols

gene_expression_omnibus_data_processing: Illumina pipeline software was used for base calling.Sequenced reads were trimmed for 3' adaptor sequence and low-quality sequence and filtered to remove reads < 50nt with TrimGalore/cutadapt.Processed reads were mapped to the reference genome/transcriptome with STAR using --quantMode GeneCounts to generate raw counts per gene.Raw counts were analyzed in R with DEseq2.Genome_build: GCF_000214275.2_ASM21427v3_genomic.gtfSupplementary_files_format_and_content: raw countsSupplementary_files_format_and_content: differential gene expression results
gene_expression_omnibus_extraction_proto: Pellet RNA was extracted using Trizol reagent. Extracted RNA was treated with Promega RQ1 RNase-Free DNase (Cat# M6101). Ribosomal RNA was subtracted using New England Biolabs NEBNext® rRNA Depletion Kit (Bacteria) (Cat# E6310), using 500-1000ng input total RNA.TruSeq-barcoded RNAseq libraries were generated using New England Biolabs NEBNext® Ultra™ II Directional RNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina® (Cat# E7765) following manufacturer instructions.
gene_expression_omnibus_growth_protocol: Bacteria were grown suspended in continuous flow membrane bioreactors with NMS media. Steady state samples were provided both methane and oxygen while substate limited samples did not receive either methane or oxygen.
gene_expression_omnibus_treatment_protoc: Reactor liquid samples were collected in 2-mL tubes and centrifuged at 10,000 rpm for 10 minutes at 4°C. Liquid supernatant was removed and extraction proceeded with bacterial pellet.

gene_expression_omnibus_data_processing: Illumina pipeline software was used for base calling.Sequenced reads were trimmed for 3' adaptor sequence and low-quality sequence and filtered to remove reads < 50nt with TrimGalore/cutadapt.Processed reads were mapped to the reference genome/transcriptome with STAR using --quantMode GeneCounts to generate raw counts per gene.Raw counts were analyzed in R with DEseq2.Genome_build: GCF_000214275.2_ASM21427v3_genomic.gtfSupplementary_files_format_and_content: raw countsSupplementary_files_format_and_content: differential gene expression results

gene_expression_omnibus_data_processing: BWA version 0.7.12-r1044 was used to align the reads to the 5GB1C genome using the BWA-MEM algorithm and default parametersRead alignments were converted into sorted BAM files using SAMTools version 1.2-232-g87cdc4aThe htseq-count tool from the “HTSeq” framework version 0.6.1p1 was used to attribute the reads to ORFs using the “intersection-nonempty” mode, providing estimates of raw read countsRaw counts were then normalized by sample and transcript length to reflect transcripts per million (TPM) for each genome feature.The locus tags refer to the locus_tag field in the *M. buryatense*  genome file, available here: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/nuccore/1678288454?report=genbankGenome_build: NCBI: NZ_CP035467.1Supplementary_files_format_and_content: TPM
gene_expression_omnibus_extraction_proto: RNA was extracted as previously described (Chu and Lidstrom, 2016).RNA sequencing and library construction was performed by GENEWIZ (South Plainfield, NJ, USA) using Illumina HiSeq

gene_expression_omnibus_extraction_proto: RNA was extracted as previously described (Chu and Lidstrom, 2016).RNA sequencing and library construction was performed by GENEWIZ (South Plainfield, NJ, USA) using Illumina HiSeq

gene_expression_omnibus_data_processing: Alignment was performed using BWA version 0.7.12-r1044 using the BWA-MEM algorithm and default parameters.The alignments were post-processed into sorted BAM files with SAMTools version 1.2-232-g87cdc4a.Reads were attributed to open reading frames (ORFs) using the htseq-count tool from the ‘HTSeq’ framework version 0.6.1p1 in the ‘intersection-nonempty’ mode.Differential abundance analysis was performed with DESeq2 1.2.10 using R 3.3.0.Genome_build: CP035467Supplementary_files_format_and_content: *.dat.txt files are two columns: locus tag and read count. At the bottom of the file five lines of summary read alignment statistics are given.
gene_expression_omnibus_extraction_proto: Once samples reached OD600 ~ 0.6-0.7, 2.5 mL of a stop solution of 5% (v/v) phenol in ethanol was added to 22.5 mL of culture. Cells were pelleted for 15 min at 4°C, and resuspended in RNA extraction buffer (a 1:3 ratio of 5% cetrimonium brimide in 2.5 M NaCl to 0.1 M phosphate buffer at pH 5.8). An equal volume of phenol-chloroform-isoamyl alcohol (25:24:1 ratio) was added, and sodium dodecyl sulfate and N-lauroylsarcosine sodium salt were each added at 0.5% (v/v). Cells were lysed in a bead beater with 0.1-mm zirconia-silica beads (Biospec Products, Bartlesville, OK, USA) for 4 min, then centrifuged at 14,000 x g for 5 min. The aqueous fraction was then washed with chloroform-isoamyl alcohol (24:1 ratio), and the aqueous fraction from this wash was precipitated overnight with 150 mM sodium acetate (pH 5.5), 1.5 mM MgCl2, and 50% isopropanol at -80°C. Precipitated RNA was harvested at 14,000 x g for 30 min at 4°C, and treated with DNase I (Ambion, Foster City, CA, USA) before purification with the RNeasy minikit and on-column DNase (Qiagen, Hilden, Germany).cDNA library preparation and RNA sequencing was performed by GENEWIZ using Illumina HiSeq 2x150 (pair ended) reads.
gene_expression_omnibus_growth_protocol: Starter cultures were grown to late logarithmic phase (OD600 ~ 0.8) and a 2% inoculum (v/v) was transferred into 50 mL NMS2 medium, under an atmosphere of 25% methane and 75% air.
gene_expression_omnibus_treatment_protoc: Wild-type and lanA- cells were growth in biological duplicate in either 0 µM or 30 µM lanthanum, for a total of 8 samples.

gene_expression_omnibus_data_processing: Alignment was performed using BWA version 0.7.12-r1044 using the BWA-MEM algorithm and default parameters.The alignments were post-processed into sorted BAM files with SAMTools version 1.2-232-g87cdc4a.Reads were attributed to open reading frames (ORFs) using the htseq-count tool from the ‘HTSeq’ framework version 0.6.1p1 in the ‘intersection-nonempty’ mode.Differential abundance analysis was performed with DESeq2 1.2.10 using R 3.3.0.Genome_build: CP035467Supplementary_files_format_and_content: *.dat.txt files are two columns: locus tag and read count. At the bottom of the file five lines of summary read alignment statistics are given.

gene_expression_omnibus_extraction_proto: Once samples reached OD600 ~ 0.6-0.7, 2.5 mL of a stop solution of 5% (v/v) phenol in ethanol was added to 22.5 mL of culture. Cells were pelleted for 15 min at 4°C, and resuspended in RNA extraction buffer (a 1:3 ratio of 5% cetrimonium brimide in 2.5 M NaCl to 0.1 M phosphate buffer at pH 5.8). An equal volume of phenol-chloroform-isoamyl alcohol (25:24:1 ratio) was added, and sodium dodecyl sulfate and N-lauroylsarcosine sodium salt were each added at 0.5% (v/v). Cells were lysed in a bead beater with 0.1-mm zirconia-silica beads (Biospec Products, Bartlesville, OK, USA) for 4 min, then centrifuged at 14,000 x g for 5 min. The aqueous fraction was then washed with chloroform-isoamyl alcohol (24:1 ratio), and the aqueous fraction from this wash was precipitated overnight with 150 mM sodium acetate (pH 5.5), 1.5 mM MgCl2, and 50% isopropanol at -80°C. Precipitated RNA was harvested at 14,000 x g for 30 min at 4°C, and treated with DNase I (Ambion, Foster City, CA, USA) before purification with the RNeasy minikit and on-column DNase (Qiagen, Hilden, Germany).cDNA library preparation and RNA sequencing was performed by GENEWIZ using Illumina HiSeq 2x150 (pair ended) reads.
gene_expression_omnibus_growth_protocol: Starter cultures were grown to late logarithmic phase (OD600 ~ 0.8) and a 2% inoculum (v/v) was transferred into 50 mL NMS2 medium, under an atmosphere of 25% methane and 75% air.
gene_expression_omnibus_treatment_protoc: Wild-type and lanA- cells were growth in biological duplicate in either 0 µM or 30 µM lanthanum, for a total of 8 samples.

gene_expression_omnibus_data_processing: Alignment was performed using BWA version 0.7.12-r1044 using the BWA-MEM algorithm and default parametersThe alignments were post-processed into sorted BAM files with SAMTools version 1.2-232-g87cdc4aReads were attributed to open reading frames (ORFs) using the htseq-count tool from the ‘HTSeq’ framework version 0.8.0 in the ‘intersection-nonempty’ modeDifferential abundance analysis was performed with DESeq2 1.2.10 and R 3.3.1.Genome_build: AOTL01000000Supplementary_files_format_and_content: TPM
gene_expression_omnibus_extraction_proto: RNA was isolated and RNA-seq data analysis was carried out as described previously (de la Torre, A. et al. 2015)RNA sequencing and library construction was performed by GENEWIZ (South Plainfield, NJ, USA) using Illumina HiSeq2500 1x50 (single ended) reads.
gene_expression_omnibus_growth_protocol: Samples for RNAseq analysis were taken from batch culture bioreactor experiments grown on either methane or methanol with pH control and continuous methane and air flow, which have been described previously (Gilman et al. 2015). Samples were taken at late log phase.

gene_expression_omnibus_extraction_proto: RNA was extracted as previously described (Chu and Lidstrom, 2016).RNA sequencing and library construction was performed by GENEWIZ (South Plainfield, NJ, USA) using Illumina HiSeq2500 1x50 (single ended) reads.
gene_expression_omnibus_growth_protocol: M. buryatense 5GB1C and its derivatives were grown in a modified NMS medium with methane at 30°C, as previously described (Puri, Owen et al. 2015). Bioreactor experiments were carried out in a New Brunswick BioFlo 310 bioreactor (Eppendorf, Inc. Enfield, CT, USA), and off gas samples were measured using Shimadzu gas chromatograph GC2014 (Shimadzu Scientific Instruments, Inc. Columbia, MD, USA) as described previously (Gilman et al., 2015), using premixed gas tanks (20% CH4, 5% O2, 75% N2) and a dilution rate of 0.03 hr-1.

Enfield, CT, USA), and off gas samples were measured using Shimadzu gas chromatograph GC2014 (Shimadzu Scientific Instruments, Inc. gene_expression_omnibus_data_processing: Reads were aligned to 20Z scaffold using BWA 0.6.1 with default parameters.Samtools 0.1.17 was used to post-process the alignments from SAM to BAM format.An in house tool 'bam2orf' was linked against the Samtools 0.1.17 libraries.  The tool processes the pileup to count the reads mapped at each base in a gene.  This number is summed across all bases in a given gene and divided by the read length.  This number is used as the input for the RPKM calculation.Genome_build: The genome was downloaded from MaGE on 09-Dec-2011 (https://www.genoscope.cns.fr/agc/microscope/mage/ ).  The scaffold designation is MEALZv4.Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Processed data files contain tab delimited tables with the locus tag and RPKM for all protein coding sequences.
gene_expression_omnibus_extraction_proto: Cells were collected by centrifugation and lysed with bead beating. RNeasy Mini Kit was used for RNA isolation including the optional DNAse digestion step.Libraries were prepared according to Illumina's instructions for 36 bp reads.
gene_expression_omnibus_growth_protocol: 50 ml culture in 250 ml vials, with shaking at 200rpm; Prior to incubation vials were flushed for 15 min with a gas mixture containing  20% CH4: 5% O2: 75% N2; Harvested at mid exponential phase

gene_expression_omnibus_data_processing: Alignment was performed using BWA version 0.7.12-r1044 using the BWA-MEM algorithm and default parameters.The alignments were post-processed into sorted BAM files with SAMTools version 1.2-232-g87cdc4a.Reads were attributed to open reading frames (ORFs) using the htseq-count tool from the ‘HTSeq’ framework version 0.6.1p1 in the ‘intersection-nonempty’ mode.Differential abundance analysis was performed with DESeq2 1.2.10 using R 3.3.0.Genome_build: NZ_JMLA01000000Genome_build: NZ_JPOH01000000Supplementary_files_format_and_content: *.txt files are two columns: locus tag (JGI) and read count. At the bottom of the file five lines of summary read alignment statistics are given.
gene_expression_omnibus_extraction_proto: Once samples reached OD600 ~ 0.6-0.7, 2.5 mL of a stop solution of 5% (v/v) phenol in ethanol was added to 22.5 mL of culture. Cells were pelleted for 15 min at 4°C, and resuspended in RNA extraction buffer (a 1:3 ratio of 5% cetrimonium brimide in 2.5 M NaCl to 0.1 M phosphate buffer at pH 5.8). An equal volume of phenol-chloroform-isoamyl alcohol (25:24:1 ratio) was added, and sodium dodecyl sulfate and N-lauroylsarcosine sodium salt were each added at 0.5% (v/v). Cells were lysed in a bead beater with 0.1-mm zirconia-silica beads (Biospec Products, Bartlesville, OK, USA) for 4 min, then centrifuged at 14,000 x g for 5 min. The aqueous fraction was then washed with chloroform-isoamyl alcohol (24:1 ratio), and the aqueous fraction from this wash was precipitated overnight with 150 mM sodium acetate (pH 5.5), 1.5 mM MgCl2, and 50% isopropanol at -80°C. Precipitated RNA was harvested at 14,000 x g for 30 min at 4°C, and treated with DNase I (Ambion, Foster City, CA, USA) before purification with the RNeasy minikit and on-column DNase (Qiagen, Hilden, Germany).cDNA library preparation and RNA sequencing was performed by GENEWIZ using Illumina HiSeq 2x150 (pair ended) reads.
gene_expression_omnibus_growth_protocol: Starter cultures were grown to late logarithmic phase (OD600 ~ 0.8) and a 2% inoculum (v/v) was transferred into 50 mL NMS2 medium, under an atmosphere of 25% methane and 75% air.
gene_expression_omnibus_treatment_protoc: Hcp mutant and wild type cells were grown under ‘high oxygen’ condition in either NMS or   AMS to OD600 of approximately 0.5, and these cells were used to inoculate replicate cultures and these were incubated as above, for another 24 hours, to OD600 of approximately 0.5. At this point, half of the samples were given the same methane/air atmosphere for one hour, after which these samples (the oxic samples) were collected. The second set of samples were given the atmosphere of methane/dinitrogen (25/75% V/V), to create hypoxic conditions, and samples were collected after 24 hours.

Cells were lysed in a bead beater with 0.1-mm zirconia-silica beads (Biospec Products, Bartlesville, OK, USA) for 4 min, then centrifuged at 14,000 x g for 5 min. The aqueous fraction was then washed with chloroform-isoamyl alcohol (24:1 ratio), and the aqueous fraction from this wash was precipitated overnight with 150 mM sodium acetate (pH 5.5), 1.5 mM MgCl2, and 50% isopropanol at -80°C. Precipitated RNA was harvested at 14,000 x g for 30 min at 4°C, and treated with DNase I (Ambion, Foster City, CA, USA) before purification with the RNeasy minikit and on-column DNase (Qiagen, Hilden, Germany).cDNA library preparation and RNA sequencing was performed by GENEWIZ using Illumina HiSeq 2x150 (pair ended) reads.

At this point, half of the samples were given the same methane/air atmosphere for one hour, after which these samples (the oxic samples) were collected. The second set of samples were given the atmosphere of methane/dinitrogen (25/75% V/V), to create hypoxic conditions, and samples were collected after 24 hours.

gene_expression_omnibus_growth_protocol: Starter cultures were grown to late logarithmic phase (OD600 ~ 0.8) and a 2% inoculum (v/v) was transferred into 50 mL NMS2 medium, under an atmosphere of 25% methane and 75% air.
gene_expression_omnibus_treatment_protoc: Hcp mutant and wild type cells were grown under ‘high oxygen’ condition in either NMS or   AMS to OD600 of approximately 0.5, and these cells were used to inoculate replicate cultures and these were incubated as above, for another 24 hours, to OD600 of approximately 0.5. At this point, half of the samples were given the same methane/air atmosphere for one hour, after which these samples (the oxic samples) were collected. The second set of samples were given the atmosphere of methane/dinitrogen (25/75% V/V), to create hypoxic conditions, and samples were collected after 24 hours.

gene_expression_omnibus_data_processing: Alignment was performed using BWA version 0.7.12-r1044 using the BWA-MEM algorithm and default parameters.The alignments were post-processed into sorted BAM files with SAMTools version 1.2-232-g87cdc4a.Reads were attributed to open reading frames (ORFs) using the htseq-count tool from the ‘HTSeq’ framework version 0.6.1p1 in the ‘intersection-nonempty’ mode.Differential abundance analysis was performed with DESeq2 1.2.10 using R 3.3.0.Genome_build: NZ_JMLA01000000Genome_build: NZ_JPOH01000000Supplementary_files_format_and_content: *.txt files are two columns: locus tag (JGI) and read count. At the bottom of the file five lines of summary read alignment statistics are given.
gene_expression_omnibus_extraction_proto: Once samples reached OD600 ~ 0.6-0.7, 2.5 mL of a stop solution of 5% (v/v) phenol in ethanol was added to 22.5 mL of culture. Cells were pelleted for 15 min at 4°C, and resuspended in RNA extraction buffer (a 1:3 ratio of 5% cetrimonium brimide in 2.5 M NaCl to 0.1 M phosphate buffer at pH 5.8). An equal volume of phenol-chloroform-isoamyl alcohol (25:24:1 ratio) was added, and sodium dodecyl sulfate and N-lauroylsarcosine sodium salt were each added at 0.5% (v/v). The aqueous fraction was then washed with chloroform-isoamyl alcohol (24:1 ratio), and the aqueous fraction from this wash was precipitated overnight with 150 mM sodium acetate (pH 5.5), 1.5 mM MgCl2, and 50% isopropanol at -80°C. gene_expression_omnibus_data_processing: Sequencing reads were processed and mapped to the respective reference sequences using the BLASR mapper (http://www.pacbiodevnet.com/SMRT-Analysis/Algorithms/BLASR) and the Pacific Biosciences' SMRT Analysis pipeline (http://www.pacbiodevnet.com/SMRT-Analysis/Software/SMRT-Pipe) using the standard mapping protocol.To identify modified positions, we used Pacific Biosciences' SMRTPortal analysis platform, v. 2.0.1, which uses an in silico kinetic reference, and a t-test based kinetic score detection of modified base positions (details are available at http://www.pacb.com/pdf/TN_Detecting_DNA_Base_Modifications.pdf)Modified sites were grouped into motifs using MotifFinder (v1)2.Genome_build: As indicated by IMG genome ID in the individual samples section (http://img.jgi.doe.gov/home.html)Supplementary_files_format_and_content: modifications.gff files are comma separated text files that contain data for genome positions with Qmod scores greater than 20; Data includes Qmod scores, IPD ratios, coverage, and sequence contexts for a +/- 20 nt window surrounding the modified position (see https://github.com/PacificBiosciences/Bioinformatics-Training/wiki/Methylome-Analysis-Technical-Note for more details)Supplementary_files_format_and_content: modifications.csv files are comma separated text files that contain data for all positions (both strands) in the reference sequence; data includes Qmod score, IPD ratio, and coverage.  (see https://github.com/PacificBiosciences/Bioinformatics-Training/wiki/Methylome-Analysis-Technical-Note for more details)Supplementary_files_format_and_content: motif_summary.csv files contain the genome-wide summary of the methyltransferase recognition motifs discovered in this sample.  (see https://github.com/PacificBiosciences/Bioinformatics-Training/wiki/Methylome-Analysis-Technical-Note for more details).Supplementary_files_format_and_content: motifs.gff files are similar to the modifications.gff files. These files contain information about all sites detected as modified, all locations of a discovered motif (including those which are apparently unmodified), and also the overlap between the modifications and motifs. (see https://github.com/PacificBiosciences/Bioinformatics-Training/wiki/Methylome-Analysis-Technical-Note for more details).
gene_expression_omnibus_extraction_proto: gDNA was randomly sheared, end repaired, and ligated to blunt end hairpin adapters to form standard SMRTbell templatesSMRT-sequencing

gene_expression_omnibus_data_processing: RNA-seq reads were aligned to reference sequence using Bowtie 1.2.1.1The sequence alignment/map (SAM) files were post-processed using SAMTools 0.1.19Differentially Expressed Genes (DEG) were analyzed by Cufflinks and Cuffdiff to calculate fragments per kilobase of exon per million fragments (FPKM) and differential expression, respectively, with default options and library type of dUTP RNA-seqGenome_build: Methylomonas sp. DH-1 plasmid, complete sequence (CP014361.1) and Methylomonas sp. DH-1, complete genome (CP014360.1)Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tab-delimited text files include FPKM values for each sample
gene_expression_omnibus_extraction_proto: Total RNA in the cell was stabilized using the bacterial reagent RNAprotect (Qiagen, Hilden, Germany). Cell lysis and total RNA were extracted using a GeneJET RNA Purification Kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific, USA) following the manufacturer’s protocolTotal RNA quality and quantity were measured using an RNA 6000 Nano kit with the Agilent Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies, CA, USA). Then rRNA was removed using Ribo-Zero rRNA removal kits (Gram-negative bacteria; Epicentre, Madison, WI, USA) and then RNA was used for sequencing library using TruSeq Stranded Total RNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina, USA) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Briefly, transcriptome sequencing was conducted using Illumina/Hiseq-2000 RNA sequencing (Macrogen, Korea).
gene_expression_omnibus_growth_protocol: Methylomonas sp. DH-1 was cultured in a nitrate mineral salt (NMS) medium containing 10 µM CuSO4 as described in our previous work. Methylomonas sp. DH-1 cells were cultured in a 500 ml baffled flask sealed with a screw cap containing 50 ml of NMS medium at 30oC and 230 rpm. Methane was supplied to a final concentration of 30% (v/v) by gas substitution using a gas-tight syringe, and the headspace was refreshed every day. Methanol-cultured Methylomonas sp. DH-1 was cultured in the same medium containing 1% (v/v) methanol without added methane. All culture was grown in triplicate for subsequent RNA extraction and sequencing.

DH-1 plasmid, complete sequence (CP014361.1) and Methylomonas sp. DH-1, complete genome (CP014360.1)Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tab-delimited text files include FPKM values for each sample
gene_expression_omnibus_extraction_proto: Total RNA in the cell was stabilized using the bacterial reagent RNAprotect (Qiagen, Hilden, Germany). Cell lysis and total RNA were extracted using a GeneJET RNA Purification Kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific, USA) following the manufacturer’s protocolTotal RNA quality and quantity were measured using an RNA 6000 Nano kit with the Agilent Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies, CA, USA). Then rRNA was removed using Ribo-Zero rRNA removal kits (Gram-negative bacteria; Epicentre, Madison, WI, USA) and then RNA was used for sequencing library using TruSeq Stranded Total RNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina, USA) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Briefly, transcriptome sequencing was conducted using Illumina/Hiseq-2000 RNA sequencing (Macrogen, Korea).
gene_expression_omnibus_growth_protocol: Methylomonas sp. DH-1 was cultured in a nitrate mineral salt (NMS) medium containing 10 µM CuSO4 as described in our previous work. Methylomonas sp. DH-1 cells were cultured in a 500 ml baffled flask sealed with a screw cap containing 50 ml of NMS medium at 30oC and 230 rpm. Methane was supplied to a final concentration of 30% (v/v) by gas substitution using a gas-tight syringe, and the headspace was refreshed every day. Methanol-cultured Methylomonas sp. DH-1 was cultured in the same medium containing 1% (v/v) methanol without added methane. All culture was grown in triplicate for subsequent RNA extraction and sequencing.

gene_expression_omnibus_data_processing: RNA-seq reads were aligned to reference sequence using Bowtie 1.2.1.1The sequence alignment/map (SAM) files were post-processed using SAMTools 0.1.19Differentially Expressed Genes (DEG) were analyzed by Cufflinks and Cuffdiff to calculate fragments per kilobase of exon per million fragments (FPKM) and differential expression, respectively, with default options and library type of dUTP RNA-seqGenome_build: Methylomonas sp. DH-1 plasmid, complete sequence (CP014361.1) and Methylomonas sp. DH-1, complete genome (CP014360.1)Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tab-delimited text files include FPKM values for each sample

gene_expression_omnibus_data_processing: Alignment was performed using BWA version 0.7.12-r1044 using the BWA-MEM algorithm and default parameters.The alignments were post-processed into sorted BAM files with SAMTools version 1.2-232-g87cdc4a.Reads were attributed to open reading frames (ORFs) using the htseq-count tool from the ‘HTSeq’ framework version 0.6.1p1 in the ‘intersection-nonempty’ mode.Differential abundance analysis was performed with DESeq2 1.2.10 using R 3.3.0.Genome_build: CP033381Supplementary_files_format_and_content: *.dat files are two columns: locus tag and read count. At the bottom of the file, a few summary read alignment statistics are given.
gene_expression_omnibus_extraction_proto: Cell pellets were lysed by bead beating with 0.1-mm zirconia-silica beads (Biospec Products) in 1 mL TRIzol (Thermo Fisher Scientific). The lysate was then separated according to the TRIzol instructions, and subsequently 1.5 volumes of 100% ethanol was added to the aqueous phase of the extract which was then used as the input for an RNeasy RNA isolation kit (Qiagen). The resulting elution was then digested using Ambion DNase I (Thermo Fisher Scientific) for 30 minutes at 37ºC before being re-purified via RNeasy RNA isolation kit with the addition of an on-column DNase (Qiagen) digestion step for 15 minutes at room temperature. The resulting purified RNA was checked for DNA contamination by PCR using the universal 16S primers 27F and 1492R.cDNA library preparation and RNA sequencing were performed by GENEWIZ using Illumina HiSeq 2x150 (pair ended) reads.
gene_expression_omnibus_growth_protocol: Methylomonas sp. strain LW13 was cultured in an atmosphere of 25% methane in air. For routine culturing plates were incubated at room temperature in sealed jars (Oxoid Limited), while liquid cultures were grown at 18ºC in 250-ml glass serum bottles (Kimble Chase) or 18- by 150-mm tubes (Bellco Glass) sealed with rubber stoppers and aluminum seals (Wheaton) shaken at 200 rpm. Cultures were grown in nitrate mineral salts (NMS) medium (38) containing 0.2 g/L MgSO4·7H2O, 0.2 g/L CaCl2·6H2­O, 1 g/L KNO3, and 30 µM LaCl as well as 1X trace elements. 500X trace elements contains 1.0 g/L Na2-EDTA, 2.0 g/L FeSO4·7H2O, 0.8 g/L ZnSO4·7H2O, 0.03 g/L MnCl2·4H2O, 0.03 g/L H3BO3, 0.2 g/L CoCl2·6H2O, 0.6 g/L CuCl2·2H2O, 0.02 g/L NiCl2·6H2O, and 0.05 g/L Na2MoO·2H2O. A final concentration of 5.8 mM phosphate buffer, pH 6.8 was added immediately before use.
gene_expression_omnibus_treatment_protoc: Growing cultures of Methylomonas sp. strain LW13 were subdiluted to OD600nm 0.01 and added to bottles containing dried 3-OH-C10-HSL (or solvent control) resulting in a final concentration of 2 µM signal. RNA was extracted during log phase (OD600nm 0.4-0.6). Briefly, cultures were chilled on ice and then centrifuged at 5000 rpm for 15 minutes at 4ºC. Pellets were subsequently flash frozen in liquid nitrogen and stored at -80ºC until further processing.

For routine culturing plates were incubated at room temperature in sealed jars (Oxoid Limited), while liquid cultures were grown at 18ºC in 250-ml glass serum bottles (Kimble Chase) or 18- by 150-mm tubes (Bellco Glass) sealed with rubber stoppers and aluminum seals (Wheaton) shaken at 200 rpm. Cultures were grown in nitrate mineral salts (NMS) medium (38) containing 0.2 g/L MgSO4·7H2O, 0.2 g/L CaCl2·6H2­O, 1 g/L KNO3, and 30 µM LaCl as well as 1X trace elements. 500X trace elements contains 1.0 g/L Na2-EDTA, 2.0 g/L FeSO4·7H2O, 0.8 g/L ZnSO4·7H2O, 0.03 g/L MnCl2·4H2O, 0.03 g/L H3BO3, 0.2 g/L CoCl2·6H2O, 0.6 g/L CuCl2·2H2O, 0.02 g/L NiCl2·6H2O, and 0.05 g/L Na2MoO·2H2O. A final concentration of 5.8 mM phosphate buffer, pH 6.8 was added immediately before use.
gene_expression_omnibus_treatment_protoc: Growing cultures of Methylomonas sp. strain LW13 were subdiluted to OD600nm 0.01 and added to bottles containing dried 3-OH-C10-HSL (or solvent control) resulting in a final concentration of 2 µM signal. RNA was extracted during log phase (OD600nm 0.4-0.6). Briefly, cultures were chilled on ice and then centrifuged at 5000 rpm for 15 minutes at 4ºC. Pellets were subsequently flash frozen in liquid nitrogen and stored at -80ºC until further processing.

gene_expression_omnibus_data_processing: Alignment was performed using BWA version 0.7.12-r1044 using the BWA-MEM algorithm and default parameters.The alignments were post-processed into sorted BAM files with SAMTools version 1.2-232-g87cdc4a.Reads were attributed to open reading frames (ORFs) using the htseq-count tool from the ‘HTSeq’ framework version 0.6.1p1 in the ‘intersection-nonempty’ mode.Differential abundance analysis was performed with DESeq2 1.2.10 using R 3.3.0.Genome_build: CP033381Supplementary_files_format_and_content: *.dat files are two columns: locus tag and read count. At the bottom of the file, a few summary read alignment statistics are given.
gene_expression_omnibus_extraction_proto: Cell pellets were lysed by bead beating with 0.1-mm zirconia-silica beads (Biospec Products) in 1 mL TRIzol (Thermo Fisher Scientific). The lysate was then separated according to the TRIzol instructions, and subsequently 1.5 volumes of 100% ethanol was added to the aqueous phase of the extract which was then used as the input for an RNeasy RNA isolation kit (Qiagen). The resulting elution was then digested using Ambion DNase I (Thermo Fisher Scientific) for 30 minutes at 37ºC before being re-purified via RNeasy RNA isolation kit with the addition of an on-column DNase (Qiagen) digestion step for 15 minutes at room temperature. The resulting purified RNA was checked for DNA contamination by PCR using the universal 16S primers 27F and 1492R.cDNA library preparation and RNA sequencing were performed by GENEWIZ using Illumina HiSeq 2x150 (pair ended) reads.

gene_expression_omnibus_extraction_proto: RNA was extracted from co-cultures and pure cultures grown with and without lanthanum. Cells were grown to an optical density 600 of approximately 0.5 for extracting RNA. We followed the procedure described earlier Chu et al 2016 Journal of Bacteriology with the following exception: we used the MPBio FastPrep® Lysing E matrix tubes. The purified RNA was tested for DNA contamination using 16S PCR. Afterwards, samples were stored at -80°C for subsequent analyses.RNA was submitted for transcriptomics analysis to GENEWIZ (Seattle, USA). 1 x 50 bp were sequenced in single-read configuration in Rapid Run mode on a HiSeq 2500 System.
gene_expression_omnibus_growth_protocol: M. tundripaludum 31/32 was pre-grown in nitrate mineral salt (NMS) medium, 30 µM lanthanum chloride and 25 % methane, 5 % air and 70 % nitrogen in the headspace. Methylotenera strains were pre-grown in the same way but with 0.1% methanol instead. We established co-cultures and controls in duplicates or triplicates in autoclaved vials in NMS medium. Different strains were  mixed together in equal starting densities (107 cells per ml). All vials were sealed with rubber stoppers and capped with crimp seals. The headspace was exchanged daily according to the following scheme: (1) Flushing with N2 gas for 30 sec (flow rate > 1.28 L/min), (2) Equalizing pressure, by removing the excess volume of N2 gas with a syringe, (3) Removing 60 ml of headspace and adding back 50 ml of methane and 10 ml of air, corresponding to an initial dissolved O2 concentration of approximately 15 µM. All vials were incubated in a shaker (200 RPM) at 18 °C.

gene_expression_omnibus_data_processing: The raw reads from the sequencing facility were aligned to the Methylobacter tundripaludum strain 21/22 genome as downloaded from JGI's IMG on Jan. 13 2016.Alignment was performed using BWA version 0.7.12-r1044 using the BWA-MEM algorithm and default parameters (Li and Durbin, 2010).The alignments were post-processed into sorted BAM files with SAMTools version 1.2-232-g87cdc4a (Li et al., 2009).Reads were attributed to open reading frames (ORFs) as well as the mbaI' pseudogene T451DRAFT_0802 using the htseq-count tool from the 'HTSeq' framework version 0.6.1p1 in the 'intersection-nonempty' mode (Anders et al., 2015).Differential abundance analysis was performed with DESeq2 1.2.10 (Anders and Huber, 2010; Anders et al., 2013) using R 3.3.0.Genome_build: Downloaded from JGI's IMG on Jan. 13 2016.Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw counts. Tab delimited text file. Locus tag annotations can be found at: https://img.jgi.doe.gov/). The genome ID is: 2563366535
gene_expression_omnibus_extraction_proto: A 1:10 volume of stop solution (5% buffer-saturated phenol in ethanol) was added to cells prior to harvesting the cells by centrifugation. Cells were resuspended in RNA extraction buffer (1:3 ratio of 5% cetrimonium bromide in 2.5 M NaCl to 0.1 M phosphate buffer [pH 5.8]) and lysed by bead beating with 0.1-mm zirconia-silica beads (Biospec Products) in 50% phenol–chloroform–isoamyl alcohol (at a 25:24:1 ratio),0.5% sodium dodecyl sulfate, and 0.5% N-lauroylsarcosine sodium salt. After centrifugation, the aqueous layer was harvested and mixed with an equal volume of chloroform-isoamyl alcohol (24:1 ratio). The aqueous layer was harvested again, and RNA was precipitated with 150 mM sodium acetate, 1.5 mM MgCl2, and 50% isopropanol (all final concentrations) overnight at 80°C. The precipitated RNA was harvested by centrifugation and treated with DNase I (Life Technologies) before purification with the RNeasy minikit and RNase-free DNase (Qiagen). We ensured that the harvested RNA was DNA free by using iScript reverse transcription supermix (Bio- Rad) with and without reverse transcriptase.Illumina HiSeq2500 1x50 (single ended) library construction prepared by GENEWIZ (South Plainfield, NJ, USA)
gene_expression_omnibus_growth_protocol: M. tundripaludum 21/22 was cultured in an atmosphere of 25% methane in air. Plates were incubated at room temperature in sealed jars (Oxoid Limited, Hampshire, United Kingdom), while liquid cultures were grown at 18C in 250-ml glass serum bottles (Kimble Chase, Vineland, NJ, USA) or 18- by 150-mm tubes (Bellco Glass, Vineland, NJ, USA) sealed with rubber stoppers and aluminum seals (Wheaton, Millville, NJ, USA). Cultures were grown in nitrate mineral salts (NMS) medium containing 0.2 g/L MgSO4·7H2O, 0.2 g/L CaCl2·6H2­O, 1 g/L KNO3, and 30 uM LaCl as well as 1X trace elements. 500X trace elements contains 1.0 g/L Na2-EDTA, 2.0 g/L FeSO4·7H2O, 0.8 g/L ZnSO4·7H2O, 0.03 g/L MnCl2·4H2O, 0.03 g/L H3BO3, 0.2 g/L CoCl2·6H2O, 0.6 g/L CuCl2·2H2O, 0.02 g/L NiCl2·6H2O, and 0.05 g/L Na2MoO·2H2O. A final concentration of 5.8 mM phosphate buffer, pH 6.8 was added immediately before use.
gene_expression_omnibus_treatment_protoc: The strain was grown the absence or presence of 1 uM 3-OH-C10-HSL.

gene_expression_omnibus_data_processing: The raw reads from the sequencing facility were aligned to the Methylobacter tundripaludum strain 21/22 genome as downloaded from JGI's IMG on Jan. 13 2016.Alignment was performed using BWA version 0.7.12-r1044 using the BWA-MEM algorithm and default parameters (Li and Durbin, 2010).The alignments were post-processed into sorted BAM files with SAMTools version 1.2-232-g87cdc4a (Li et al., 2009).Reads were attributed to open reading frames (ORFs) as well as the mbaI' pseudogene T451DRAFT_0802 using the htseq-count tool from the 'HTSeq' framework version 0.6.1p1 in the 'intersection-nonempty' mode (Anders et al., 2015).Differential abundance analysis was performed with DESeq2 1.2.10 (Anders and Huber, 2010; Anders et al., 2013) using R 3.3.0.Genome_build: Downloaded from JGI's IMG on Jan. 13 2016.Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw counts. gene_expression_omnibus_growth_protocol: M. tundripaludum 21/22 was cultured in an atmosphere of 25% methane in air. Plates were incubated at room temperature in sealed jars (Oxoid Limited, Hampshire, United Kingdom), while liquid cultures were grown at 18C in 250-ml glass serum bottles (Kimble Chase, Vineland, NJ, USA) or 18- by 150-mm tubes (Bellco Glass, Vineland, NJ, USA) sealed with rubber stoppers and aluminum seals (Wheaton, Millville, NJ, USA). Cultures were grown in nitrate mineral salts (NMS) medium containing 0.2 g/L MgSO4·7H2O, 0.2 g/L CaCl2·6H2­O, 1 g/L KNO3, and 30 uM LaCl as well as 1X trace elements. 500X trace elements contains 1.0 g/L Na2-EDTA, 2.0 g/L FeSO4·7H2O, 0.8 g/L ZnSO4·7H2O, 0.03 g/L MnCl2·4H2O, 0.03 g/L H3BO3, 0.2 g/L CoCl2·6H2O, 0.6 g/L CuCl2·2H2O, 0.02 g/L NiCl2·6H2O, and 0.05 g/L Na2MoO·2H2O. A final concentration of 5.8 mM phosphate buffer, pH 6.8 was added immediately before use.
gene_expression_omnibus_treatment_protoc: The strain was grown the absence or presence of 1 uM 3-OH-C10-HSL.

gene_expression_omnibus_data_processing: Sequencing reads were processed and mapped to the respective reference sequences using the BLASR mapper (http://www.pacbiodevnet.com/SMRT-Analysis/Algorithms/BLASR) and the Pacific Biosciences' SMRT Analysis pipeline (http://www.pacbiodevnet.com/SMRT-Analysis/Software/SMRT-Pipe) using the standard mapping protocol.To identify modified positions, we used Pacific Biosciences' SMRTPortal analysis platform, v. 2.0.1, which uses an in silico kinetic reference, and a t-test based kinetic score detection of modified base positions (details are available at http://www.pacb.com/pdf/TN_Detecting_DNA_Base_Modifications.pdf)Modified sites were grouped into motifs using MotifFinder (v1)2.Genome_build: As indicated by IMG genome ID in the individual samples section (http://img.jgi.doe.gov/home.html)Supplementary_files_format_and_content: modifications.gff files are comma separated text files that contain data for genome positions with Qmod scores greater than 20; Data includes Qmod scores, IPD ratios, coverage, and sequence contexts for a +/- 20 nt window surrounding the modified position (see https://github.com/PacificBiosciences/Bioinformatics-Training/wiki/Methylome-Analysis-Technical-Note for more details)Supplementary_files_format_and_content: modifications.csv files are comma separated text files that contain data for all positions (both strands) in the reference sequence; data includes Qmod score, IPD ratio, and coverage.  (see https://github.com/PacificBiosciences/Bioinformatics-Training/wiki/Methylome-Analysis-Technical-Note for more details)Supplementary_files_format_and_content: motif_summary.csv files contain the genome-wide summary of the methyltransferase recognition motifs discovered in this sample.  (see https://github.com/PacificBiosciences/Bioinformatics-Training/wiki/Methylome-Analysis-Technical-Note for more details).Supplementary_files_format_and_content: motifs.gff files are similar to the modifications.gff files. These files contain information about all sites detected as modified, all locations of a discovered motif (including those which are apparently unmodified), and also the overlap between the modifications and motifs. (see https://github.com/PacificBiosciences/Bioinformatics-Training/wiki/Methylome-Analysis-Technical-Note for more details).
gene_expression_omnibus_extraction_proto: gDNA was randomly sheared, end repaired, and ligated to blunt end hairpin adapters to form standard SMRTbell templatesSMRT-sequencing
